input_text:
Job Title: Economic Analyst

Location: Austin, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Finance, Sales

Description:
Analyst and Senior Analyst:
Analysts with Nouvelle Analytics work with project managers to advise companies, individuals, and their attorneys on a broad range of issues in connection with litigation, mediation and arbitration. Clients rely on our expertise when dealing with complex business matters or when facing a dispute or potential dispute. As an Analyst, you will focus the large majority of your time on intellectual property related engagements with a secondary emphasis on general commercial dispute engagements. Intellectual property valuation matters will focus primarily on patented technology but will also include valuation of trademarks, copyrights, trade secrets, know-how, and license agreements. Intellectual property valuation assignments will be performed in many different contexts including: transaction advisory (buy-sell, licensing, M&A, joint ventures, etc.), strategic decision-making, and others. General commercial dispute engagements may include fraud, breach of contract, and business interruption matters.
Responsibilities:Coordinating engagements to ensure the end product will support thorough and grounded expert opinions and/or provide quality consulting services to attorneys within established time framesProviding guidance to attorneys on key financial and business issuesDeveloping and/or evaluating damages claims and calculationsCreating financial models, cash flow analyses, completing business related valuations, and other analyses as dictated by the needs of the client company or transactionDrafting of internal and external communications, including client proposals and expert reports
Requirements:Bachelor's degree in Economics, Finance, Accounting, Statistics or Accounting, or Finance from an accredited college or universityMinimum GPA 3.2/4.0Strong financial modeling skillsThorough knowledge of corporate finance principles and financial statementsStrong mathematical, analytical, research, comprehension and quantitative skills as well as strong verbal and written communication skillsExcellent time management and organization skillsAbility to master new tasks quicklyDemonstrated leadership experience and strong personal integrityAbility to prioritize tasks, work on multiple assignments and manage rapidly changing assignments in a team environmentDemonstrated commitment to obtaining outstanding resultsComputer proficiency and ability to maximize applications such as Microsoft Word and Excel

Experience Level (if available): None
